frontmatter.title: A Study on CNN performance using Tensorflow and Keras

node.html: A notebook to study the effectiveness of Convolutional Neural Networks at image recognition, via a massive dataset consisting of a variety of clothing articles and benchmarking the model's capability of classifying them. After a testing period of 50 epochs and the addition of numerous dropout layers to combat overfitting, I ended with an overall accuracy of 93.4%, which could have easily been improved with further tweaking.

A series of visualizations I created in order to document and analyze terrorism or terrorism-related incidents around the world. Did so using a combination of seaborn, plotly, and matplotlib visualizations.

frontmatter.title: A Prediction on Passenger Survivability aboard the Titanic

node.html: A prediction model I created during Kaggle's Titanic Prediction competition to analyze the survivability of passengers aboard the Titanic using weights such as gender, cabin, age, family aboard, fare, and more. One of my first attempts at clearly and thoroughly documenting my thoughts during the modeling and data-cleaning phases. I utilized a number of models such as support vector machines, logistic and multilinear regression, k-nearest neighbors, and decision trees to analyze each of their efficiencies at this paticular dataset.

A series of ML models using supervised and unsupervised methods in order to detect exoplanets that are contenders for sustaining life. The models include logistic regression, stochastic GD, Naive Bayes, K-Means clustering, and more.
